t: Matthew 9
And*p he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.

And,*p behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son,*r be*r of*r good*r cheer;*r thy*r sins*r be*r forgiven*r thee.*r
And,*p behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.
And*p Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore*r think*r ye*r evil*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
For*rp whether*r is*r easier,*r to*r say,*r Thy*r sins*r be*r forgiven*r thee;*r or*r to*r say,*r Arise,*r and*r walk?*r

But*rp that*r ye*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r hath*r power*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins,*r (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise,*r take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r go*r unto*r thine*r house.*r
And*p he arose, and departed to his house.
But*p when the multitudes saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.
And*p as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow*r me.*r And he arose, and followed him.
And*p it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.
And*p when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
But*p when Jesus heard that, he said unto them, They*r that*r be*r whole*r need*r not*r a*r physician,*r but*r they*r that*r are*r sick.*r

But*rp go*r ye*r and*r learn*r what*r that*r meaneth,*r I*r will*r have*r mercy,*r and*r not*r sacrifice:*r for*r I*r am*r not*r come*r to*r call*r the*r righteous,*r but*r sinners*r to*r repentance.*r
Then*p came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?

And*p Jesus said unto them, Can*r the*r children*r of*r the*r bridechamber*r mourn,*r as*r long*r as*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r with*r them?*r but*r the*r days*r will*r come,*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r shall*r be*r taken*r from*r them,*r and*r then*r shall*r they*r fast.*r

No*rp man*r putteth*r a*r piece*r of*r new*r cloth*r unto*r an*r old*r garment,*r for*r that*r which*r is*r put*r in*r to*r fill*r it*r up*r taketh*r from*r the*r garment,*r and*r the*r rent*r is*r made*r worse.*r

Neither*rp do*r men*r put*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r bottles:*r else*r the*r bottles*r break,*r and*r the*r wine*r runneth*r out,*r and*r the*r bottles*r perish:*r but*r they*r put*r new*r wine*r into*r new*r bottles,*r and*r both*r are*r preserved.*r
While*p he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.
And*p Jesus arose, and followed him, and so did his disciples.
And,*p behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind him, and touched the hem of his garment:
For*p she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.
But*p Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter,*r be*r of*r good*r comfort;*r thy*r faith*r hath*r made*r thee*r whole.*r And the woman was made whole from that hour.
And*p when Jesus came into the ruler's house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,
He*p said unto them, Give*r place:*r for*r the*r maid*r is*r not*r dead,*r but*r sleepeth.*r And they laughed him to scorn.
But*p when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.
And*p the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.
And*p when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, Thou Son of David, have mercy on us.
And*p when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe*r ye*r that*r I*r am*r able*r to*r do*r this?*r They said unto him, Yea, Lord.
Then*p touched he their eyes, saying, According*r to*r your*r faith*r be*r it*r unto*r you.*r
And*p their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See*r that*r no*r man*r know*r it.*r
But*p they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.
As*p they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.
And*p when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.
But*p the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.
And*p Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
But*p when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.
Then*p saith he unto his disciples, The*r harvest*r truly*r is*r plenteous,*r but*r the*r labourers*r are*r few;*r
Pray*rp ye*r therefore*r the*r Lord*r of*r the*r harvest,*r that*r he*r will*r send*r forth*r labourers*r into*r his*r harvest.*r
